caption: Deeeelicious! True Cuban cuisine. The food was so flavorful, presented beautifully and was super fresh. The staff was very hospitable and attentive. The flan tasted like it was homemade with the perfect texture and just the right amount of sweetness. We are absolutely going to be regulars of this wonderful spot.
This place is great for a date night if you want to have a nice and peaceful dinner
Great food, friendly service and nice ambiance.
We sat outside. Server was very nice. Great mojito and lachon. Spicy roasted salsa was amazing

The food is amazing. I am originally from NYC, and very fortunate to have such great restaurant near me. All the plates remind me of my mother's cooking. We order two days in a row. Hands down, the best Cuban Restaurant so far.
The food was delicious! Not to mention the awsome people who work here!

Absolutely divine meal. I went to college in Florida and have been searching for Cuban food ever since, and was surprised to find this right in my SO’s backyard! We ordered takeout (to be covid-conscious) and do not regret a single thing. The tostones were perfectly crisped, the croquetas tasted incredible, his Cuban sandwich is one of the best either of us have ever tried, and my vaca frita reminded me so much of South Florida I *nearly cried*. Delicious. We topped it off with a manchego cheesecake that was nothing short of incredible. I cannot wait to make this a regular spot of ours!!
A little touch of Miami  and Cuba , love the food even with the ongoing restrictions they turn out a nice selection of cuban comfort food.

This is response to the obviously ill-intentioned review accusing Cubano's of "bland" flavor.  First:  With Covid it's hard to run a restaurant, and please everyone. I have patronized this establishment and its other locations, even in Fort Lauderdale, Florida which recently opened. And it is THE REAL DEAL and TASTES AMAZING since I have patronized them since 2007!  Note: I AM CUBAN! Transplant from Miami and can tell you Cubano's fare is ALWAYS as Cuban food should taste PERFECTLY SAVORY!!!  Whoever is complaining about flavor must be seeking Thai or Mexican foods and most likely hasn't travelled much, and certainly is clueless about our national cuisine.  Allow me to educate the clueless... Cuban food, and most Latin-American food also, by the way, is NOT SPICY.  Trust a genuine Cuban when I tell you this is as the MOST AUTHENTIC and BEST-TASTING CUBAN FOOD outside of my own kitchen!!  Not only the food, but the AMBIANCE, the waiters, the owners, the hosts, are all the most attentive, genuine, friendly, caring, people I have ever found in any establishment nearby.  If you want cheap, salty, over-priced fare, as the charge seems to be leveled here, I suggest walking across the street to bask in salt, corn, and meat buried under spices so you can't tell its age.  Something about a Ranch.  So go spend your thirty dollars per person to eat industrial warehouse bagged chips and canned dip. But please, don't insult quality cooking.  Everything at Cubano's is FRESH, and DELICIOUS....I do agree, prices are a tad steep for Cuban fare. But this being our area where they corner the market....don't even bother going to the nightmare Cuban place on Rockville Pike, forgot the name....and address luckily.  Don't listen to me, or the ones trying to diminish the real quality and service you will find at Cubano's.
Excellent salsa music, food,and service

It resembled Cuban food. Everything was dry, over cooked, and bland. As an example, the vaca frita (a Cuban staple) managed to be too salty and flavorless, as well as over cooked. And it's expensive! I've had better Latino food at Pollo Tropical.
Delicious Cuban dishes and great Rum Bar. The Mojitos are excellent and available in many different flavors. Want a taste of the island this is the place to go.
Everything was exceptional, food, sangria, service.   Great time!
Food and service were great! For sure we are coming back

Tried the Cubano sandwich for the first time. It was one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. The braised pork was delicious and juicy and the pickles and mustard added a great kick to the sandwich without tasting too strong. The potato chips were fresh and crispy too! Would 10/10 recommend.

So, what i thought was the location that i visited last year, was the silver spring location. This Bethesda restaurant was a very enjoyable experience. My friend and i ordered 4 appetizers and two entrees. Every meal had presentation and mouth watering tastes. I was really impressed by the service too. A huge to thanks to the bartender for those delicious mojitos, our server Jimena, who was informative and nice and patient and encore to the chef!

(Translated by Google) Too good and not to mention the attention, incredible ... incredible. Try this seafood stew  (Original) Demasiado bueno y ni hablar de la atención, increible..increíble. Prueben este asopado de Mariscos

The food is just ok. Definitely not bad, but not great either. I expected more nuanced flavors for how pricey the food is. Everything was fine, but a bit bland and not very complex.    My husband said his fish tasted like it was just doused in old Bay.
Food and service were top notch.
Fantastic food and good sangria.

So this is a combination review from me and the wife. She grew up in Key West and ate Cubano sandwiches her entire life (Sandy's Cafe). She introduced me to cubanos 10 years ago and I have gone S far as to smuggle them back to the DMV. So when we hear about a Cuban restaurant we must look into it.  So during the Cov-ID quarantine we discovered they Cubanos Restaurant was doing limited hours of carry out. My wife went in and placed the order I stood outside. I looked in the window and felt the atmosphere looked like it belonged in Key West or Cuba so point for them. The Cubanos were $16 a piece (ouch) we must take a point away.  The pork was slow roasted and delicious if a bit bland deducting 1/2 point for that.  Pickles not sour enough and need to be a little thicker. Deducting 1/4 point for that.  The mustard was not tart enough and  I think the wrong type was used.  We have to take 1/4 point  Even though the bread was not actual Cuban bread, it was well toasted and soft while hearty enough to hold the sandwich together. Point there  The chips were very good. Freshly made and tasty. That's a point.  My final grade: B- My wifes' grade: B+  Final assessment Solid B.  A little pricey but good food.
This place adds to the variety of cuisines on Cordell. I had the oxtail stew but I'll be trying their Cubano sandwich next time.
Fantastico!  Authentic cuban food with great atmosphere. Very nice staff ready to make your experience as pleasant as possible.
